original: Lundmark, Frey, med. dr, lasarettsläkare, Vadstena, f. 23/3/04 i Karlskrona av las :läk. Rudolf L. o. Esther Andersson. G. 31 m. Asta Nordbeck. Barn: Anders f. 32, Dag 37. — Studiex. i Karlskrona 23, med. kand. i Upps. 27, med. lic. där 32 samt med. dr 45. E. o. aman. v. patolog, inst. i Upps. 28-29, assist :läk. v. Akad. sjukh. med. avd. 31, bitr. sjuk-h :läk. v. flottans sjukh. i Karlskrona 32-33, tf. andre und :läk. v. Lidköp. las. med. avd. 33 o. 34, ord. und :läk. s’amt vik. lasrläk. där 34-38, assist :-läk. o. tf. aman. v. Akad. sjukh. med. avd. i Linköp. 42-46, las:läk. v. klin. samt tf. und :läk. o. överläk. där 38-42, bitr. samt vik. las :läk. v. med. avd. i Linköp. 42-46, tf. las :läk. v. med. avd. å Vadstena las. sed. 46. Ma-rinläk:stip. över stat 32, marinläk :stip. v. Mlk 33, marinläk. av andra gr. i res. 34, av första gr. i res. 42. Skr.: Fem fall av trichinos (37), Fall av egendoml. granulomatös hudaffektion m. organamyloidos (38), Några reflex. m. anledn. av en andra tularemiepid. i Söderfors hösten 38 (39), Trigeminus-reflex v. decerebrate rigidity o. v. kontrakt» facialispares (41), Klin. un-dersökn. över pupillotoni o. dess relät, t. reflektorisk pupillstelhet (grad:-avh. 45).
translated: Lundmark, Frey, MD, hospital doctor, Vadstena, b. 23/3/04 in Karlskrona to Dr. Rudolf L. and Esther Andersson. Married on 31 with Asta Nordbeck. Children: Anders b. 32, Dag 37. — Completed studies in Karlskrona in 1923, obtained a Bachelor of Medicine degree in Uppsala in 1927, a medical license there in 1932, and a doctorate in medicine in 1945. Acting assistant at the Institute of Pathology in Uppsala from 1928-1929, medical assistant at the Academic Hospital Medical Department in 1931, assistant medical officer at the Navy Hospital in Karlskrona from 1932-1933, acting second assistant medical officer at Lidköping Hospital Medical Department in 1933 and 1934, and regular assistant medical officer and substitute hospital doctor there from 1934-1938. Assistant medical officer and acting assistant at the Academic Hospital Medical Department in Linköping from 1942-1946, hospital doctor and acting second assistant and senior physician there from 1938-1942, and deputy and substitute hospital doctor at the Medical Department in Linköping from 1942-1946. Temporary hospital doctor at Vadstena Hospital since 1946. Received a scholarship from the Naval Medical Corps in 1932, a scholarship from the Military Medical Corps in 1933, promoted to second grade naval physician in 1934, and promoted to first grade naval physician in 1942. Published works: Five cases of trichinosis (1937), Case of peculiar granulomatous skin affection with organ amyloidosis (1938), Several reflexes due to a second tularemia epidemic in Söderfors in the autumn of 1938 (1939), Trigeminal reflex in decerebrate rigidity and facial paralysis contracture (1941), Clinical examination of pupillotonia and its relationship to reflex pupillary rigidity (degree-dependent) (1945).
